root.name: getInt()

example.code: def setup(): table = Table() table.addColumn("number", Table.INT) table.addColumn("mass", Table.FLOAT) table.addColumn("name", Table.STRING) table.addRow() # Creates an empty row table.setInt(0, "number", 8) table.setFloat(0, "mass", 15.9994) table.setString(0, "name", "Oxygen") print(table.getInt(0, "number")) # Prints 8 print(nf(table.getFloat(0, "mass"), 2, 4)) # Prints 15.9994 print(table.getString(0, "name")) # Prints "Oxygen"

root.description: Retrieves an integer value from the Table's specified row and column. The row is specified by its ID, while the column may be specified by either its ID or title.

parameter.label: row
parameter.description: int: ID number of the row to reference

parameter.label: column
parameter.description: int: ID number of the column to reference

parameter.label: columnName
parameter.description: String: title of the column to reference
